codeToColor.explanation: Paste five primary colors, an accent color, and at least five neutral colors in whatever code format you like. The colors will be filled by the pasted order.

chooseTwoColors.title: Choose two colors
chooseTwoColors.explanationPartTwo: or take any other color palette and pick three colors you like from the same color palette or use a picture which represents the mood for your app and pick three colors from there.

pickPrimaryColor.title: Pick primary colors
pickPrimaryColor.explanation: Decide which color should be your primary color. Click on the middle element and use the picker to select this color. Then pick a darker color in the top, moving on the x-axis and a lighter color for the bottom. This color should use up about 30%.

pickAccentColor.title: Pick accent color
pickAccentColor.explanation: Decide which color should be your accent color. This color is only used 10% of the time to draw attention, e.g. for a call to action button.

pickNeutralColors.title: Pick secondary colors
pickNeutralColors.explanation: Pick the secondary, neutral color. Then move a little down and right for each darker color above. Do the opposite for the lighter colors until you nearly reach the top and left with the last color. These colors are used 60% of the time.

previewDesign.title: Preview design
previewDesign.explanation: This is an example on how a design could look. In the next tab you can view more combinations and adjust individual elements' colors by clicking on them.
